Question 80) The Intergovernmental Panel of Climate Change (in the acronym in English, IPCC) provides that in the coming decades the planet will undergo climate change and proposes mitigation and adaptation strategies to them. Mitigation strategies are directed to the cause of these changes, seeking to reduce the concentration of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere. Adaptation strategies, in turn, are directed to the effects of these changes, seeking to prepare human systems to climate change already in progress, in order to reduce their negative effects.
Considering text information, what action represents an adaptation strategy?
A) Construction of wind power plants.
B) Solid waste treatment.
C) Increased vehicle efficiency.
D) adoption of low carbon sustainable agriculture.
E) Creation of containment dikes in coastal regions.
